ou'll probably get
to an EJB testing framework.  The approach it takes is t=
o run the tests from
it's own servlet, so you're running the test in the co=
ntainer.  It makes for
a good integration test (make sure it's deployed cor=
rectly, etc.).
Deploying to run tests may slow things down a little.

Anoth=
er option would be mock objects (http://www.mockobjects.com,
http://www.eas=
ymock.org).  It has a lot of mock objects that will make your
EJB think it'=
s in a container.  I actually haven't tried them for EJBs, but

the first place I would go.
